City of Haverhill Mayor's Office - Official is at Hill View Montessori Charter Public School.
January 21 at 3:10 PM · Haverhill, MA ·

This morning I visited #Haverhill’s Hill View Montessori Charter Public School, 75 Foundation Ave. in Ward Hill. I met some great teachers and administrators and many, many great students. This is a K-8 tuition-free public school and most of the kids said they are looking forward to attending Haverhill High School, with a few saying they hope to attend Whittier Voc-Tech in Haverhill. One group of students is building picnic tables and they asked if they could donate one to the city. Another group told me about how they recently excelled at a model United Nations competition at Haverhill High. Great kids and a beautiful and spacious building... This visit was part of my ongoing effort to visit all Haverhill schools on a regular basis. Thanks again to Executive Director Phil Arnold for inviting me -- I hope to come back soon! Click here for more info about the school: www.hillviewmontessori.org

The Sequoia Classroom of 2015-16 created this mural to honor Maria Montessori and her work in education. The Sequoia room students explained why they selected each of the objects as part of the mural:
* We chose the world and the person above it because it is our school logo, and Montessori education is global.
* The key is there because Maria Montessori said that children are the “key to education”.
* The bead frame and the grammar symbols were chosen because Maria Montessori created them to help children learn.
* Finally, we chose a Montessori quote that represents her philosophy: “One test of the correctness of educational
procedure is the happiness of the child”

post_text: As children grow, they contribute to increasingly expansive and diverse human and environmental communities. As a result, community service is important part of the curriculum throughout HVM, culminating in middle school where each student is required to participate in at least 20 hours of service each year. This morning, HVM’s 7th and 8th grade students helped in various ways across Merrimack Valley. A special thank you goes out to our HVM parents for making this happen with your support.

• Visual Art: You will see painting, embroidery, quilts and donated items by kids and our own Miss Marti.
